newsitem.title: UK: London gold slips to fix at lowest since Jan 1995.
newsitem.headline: London gold slips to fix at lowest since Jan 1995.

text.p: Gold was fixed at $373.50 per ounce on Tuesday afternoon, down a dollar from the morning fixing and its lowest fix since January 9, 1995.
The market has been under pressure since late last week, which accelerated following a sharp sell-off by speculators in New York on Monday.
"I think it's going to stabilise around here in the short term. It should hold technically in the $372-$375 area," a London-based dealer said.
Market sentiment was overwhelmingly bearish as investors shunned gold in favour of surging equities markets, and physical demand remained lower than expected.
Fears over the prospect of gold sales by miners and European central banks were also helping depress the price, dealers said.
